comment._content: I was born 100 years too late...

comment.author: 39580416@N04
51979177@N02
comment._content: I'm not sure, but I think that the phrenologist's sign has his address as '209 Elizabeth Street'...so I'd say that the sign was an advertising sign rather than a sign erected above his rooms (or whatever phrenologists have)...unless he had a branch office at the NZ Hotel...Beech seems to have moved around a bit during his time in Sydney...per this notice he was at 209 Elizabeth St in April 1889 (column e, 'Personal', 12th item) - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13719295 ... by April 1890 he gives his address as 225 Elizabeth St (mid way down column d, 'To Country People') - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13767302 ...so maybe this pic was taken in ca. 1889...I haven't managed to get any newspaper hits for McGuinness's Hotel, if that's the name of the establishment on the lh side of the street.
